subject: Self Care
title: Notification Manipulation
description: A quick, practical guide to Notification Manipulation.

hook.text: Every notification triggers a tiny dopamine hit. Your phone buzzes 80 times a day. That's 80 attention hijacks.

buildup.text: Notifications exploit the novelty response. The brain prioritizes new information over current tasks automatically.

discovery.text: It takes an average of 23 minutes to fully refocus after a single interruption. Multiply that by 80 notifications.

twist.text: Most notifications aren't urgent or important. They exist to pull you back into the app, not to serve your needs.

climax.text: Turn off all non-essential notifications today. Keep calls and messages from real people. Delete the rest.

punchline.text: Turn off notifications. Reclaim 80 interruptions daily.

quiz.question: How long does it take to fully refocus after one notification interruption?
